subject: p18224196
History: To evaluate for the Dobbhoff tube placement.
Findings: A Dobbhoff tube ends into the stomach however, coiled in the mid esophagus. Right internal jugular sheath tip is at upper SVC. There is evidence of prior median sternotomy for mitral valve replacement and tricuspid valvuloplasty. Allowing for differences in technique, mild-to-moderate right pleural effusion has minimally increased, while moderate left pleural effusion with complaining left lower lung atelectasis is unchanged over last 24 hours. Very mild pulmonary vascular congestion is unchanged. Post-operative cardiomediastinal silhouette has an expected post-op appearance and stable. There is no pneumothorax. The findings regarding Dobbhoff tube was already communicated by Dr. With by phone at 6:35 pm. On .
